intro: Stellarioides viriduliflora, commonly known as green-flowered starwort, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
